I am looking to add the following functionality to my tests:
- When provide=
d a list of method names on the command line, only those
methods in the inv=
oked class will be executed.

I need this implementation at the test class =
level. This was pretty
straightforward with JUnit 3.8.1 - just create new i=
nstances of the
derived TestCase with the method name as the argument, and =
add them to
the suite.

I am having a lot of difficulty trying to replicate=
 this
functionality. The filter logic appears to be a one-shot exclusion
fi=
lter (everything not matching is dropped), and I can't seem to find
any doc=
umentation that would address this.

As Mr. Rainsberger and others have sug=
gested, I have searched the web
for an appropriate tutorial. I have found a=
 number of good basic
tutorials (including some references in this group), =
and a couple with
some advanced content. I cannot seem to find one with the=
 detail to
unlock the tools and capabilities that I am positive are availab=
le
within the new JUnit framework. 

I am also convinced that no one is as =
capable as the authors in
documenting the features of the framework, and I =
am having trouble
find Javadoc for some of the classes and APIs in the JUni=
t 4.1 tree.
There is a fairly good chance that I am looking in the wrong pl=
ace.

If anyone has any suggestions or guidance on these issues, it would b=
e
greatly appreciated.

Thanks in advance!

Michael Schechter
